description: I haven't thought this through entirely, and it's super simple and not revolutionary.  But, when someone is admitted to a healthcare facility with a Dx of Ebola, healthcare workers should have PPE that is effective, yet easy to put on and take off.  Maybe a one-piece suit of some type that could be quickly donned when entering a patient's room and then doffed before leaving.  It shouldn't add more than 30 seconds to the overall time frame.
summary: My daughter recently had a terrible MRSA infection and spent 5 days in the hospital receiving intravenous antibiotic therapy and wound care.  The healthcare workers rarely used PPE, mostly because the hospital was understaffed. My idea is to PREVENT Ebola by coming up with simple steps for using PPE and quarantine.  Also, creating PPE that is easy to put on and take off would be helpful, like a one-piece suit that covers face, hands...everything.
title: Prevent The Spread Using PPE
